title: Prevent isListening from being undefined
body:
Hello
This PR is to solve the problem listed below.
(We are using React v15.4.1)

---
We had a very weird issue with `ReactBrowserEventEmitter` in Internet Explorer 11. That was caused by [`getListeningForDocument` function](https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/master/src/renderers/dom/shared/ReactBrowserEventEmitter.js#L156) returning `undefined` in some circumstances when called in [`listenTo` function](https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/master/src/renderers/dom/shared/ReactBrowserEventEmitter.js#L227).   
That caused an exception [here](https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/master/src/renderers/dom/shared/ReactBrowserEventEmitter.js#L236) and broke our app:
```
// isListening is `undefined` in our case
// As all you know, calling a method on `undefined` throws an error
if (!(
       isListening.hasOwnProperty(dependency) &&
       isListening[dependency]
)) { ...
```  
---

**Why `getListeningForDocument` function returned `undefined`:**
[this condition](https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/master/src/renderers/dom/shared/ReactBrowserEventEmitter.js#L159) evaluated to `false` because `mountAt` object had such a property. But the bad thing is that this property's value was `undefined`.


---

It's very weird that such a problem came out. I have not managed to "google" similar issues.

This PR solves the problem but doesn't answer the question why such a strange behavior (as explained above) happened.
